00016 TEST(BasicTests, DenormBasic) {
00017 
00018     // args are value, min, max
00019     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.0, 0.0, 1.0), 0);
00020 
00021     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.5, 0.0, 1.0), 0.5);
00022     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.5, 1.0, 0.0), 0.5);
00023 
00024     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(1.0, 0.0, 1.0), 1);
00025 
00026     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.5, -100.0, 100.0), 0);
00027 
00028     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.8, -100.0, 100.0), 60);
00029 
00030     // note that this handles ints just fine
00031     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.95, 0, 5), 4.75);
00032 
00033     EXPECT_EQ(denorm(0.5, 0, 5), 2.5);
00034 
00035 
00036     // if given value is outside of 0-1, throw an out of range exception
00037     ASSERT_THROW(denorm(-5), std::out_of_range);
00038 
00039 }

00042 TEST(BasicTests, RandRangeBasic) {
00043 
00044     // args are min, max
00045     // always within range of 1 less than max
00046     EXPECT_EQ(randRange(5, 6), 5);
00047     EXPECT_EQ(randRange(0, 1), 0);
00048     EXPECT_EQ(randRange(20000, 20001), 20000);
00049 
00050     std::vector<long> a;
00051     for (long i=0; i<10; i++) {
00052         a.push_back(randRange(0,10)); // values 0 to 9 generated
00053     }
00054     printVector(a, "randRange between 0 and 9");
00055 
00056 
00057     std::vector<int> b;
00058     for (int i=0; i<10; i++) {
00059         b.push_back(randRange(100,104)); // values 0 to 9 generated
00060     }
00061     printVector(b, "randRange between 100 and 104");
00062 
00063     std::vector<int> c;
00064     for (int i=0; i<10; i++) {
00065         c.push_back(randRange(-20,-10)); // values 0 to 9 generated
00066     }
00067     printVector(c, "randRange between -20 and -10");
00068 
00069 
00070 }

00075 
00076     // args are min, max
00077     // always within range of 1 less than max
00078     EXPECT_EQ(randUnit() > 0, true);
00079     EXPECT_EQ(randUnit() < 1, true);

00087 
00088     // args are min, max
00089     // always within range of 1 less than max
